result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jessie J Howen

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jessie J Howen in court with attorney Ryan Drengler. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
All files heard: 13CF372, 13CF390, 14CF34, 14CF35, 14CF155, 14CF287, 14CF426, 14CM165
11:06 a.m.  Court calls the cases. 

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Court questions Atty Drengler re: competency of client. 
Atty Drengler believes his client is still competent at this time. 

Prosecutor states plea agreement.
 Parties stipulate to the evaluation by Dr. Baker.  Proposes the Court enter those pleas as NGI and place the defendant on supervision.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
13CF372 Counts 1 & 2 - NO CONTEST while maintaining NGI. 
14CF34 Count 1 - NO CONTEST while maintaining NGI.
14CF287 Count 1 - NO CONTEST while maintaining NGI.

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty.  Court does not enter the conviction as parties have stipulated to the reports of Dr. Baker.  Court reads the opinion of Dr. Baker
Both counsel agree to the stipulation. 

BY THE COURT:  
Court further finds the defendant Not Guilty by Reason of Mental disease or defect in 13CF372 Counts 1 & 2, 14CF34 Count 1 and 14CF287 Count 1.  

Court questions parties re: maximum penalties. 
Atty Knaapen makes statements.  Believe the maximum penalties would be 30 years. 
Atty Drengler makes statements.  Asks court to amend the Order he had prepared. 
Court amends the maximums on the Order. 
Atty Knaapen suggests an 8 year period of commitment in 13CF372 and 6 years on each of the bail jumpings (14CF34 & 14CF287) to run concurrent. 
Atty Drengler makes statements to the Court.  The victim is present and would like to address the court prior.  Makes additional arguments to the Court. 
Victim makes statements to the Court. 
Court questions the victim. 
Atty Knaapen makes statements to the Court. 
Court questions sentence credit. 
Atty Drengler indicates there are 7 days credit total. 
Court will not put the credit on the order yet but will add the credit later to ensure there is the correct amount. 
Court questions if parties agree to the orders running concurrently.
Parties agree to concurrent orders. 

BY THE COURT: 
Court enters an Order that the defendant be committed to DHS in 13CF372 for a period of 8 years and in 14CF34 & 14CF287 for 6 years, running concurrent.
The days of credit will be added after they are determined. 
Court orders a Pre-Disposition Investigation.  
The Court orders DHS to conduct the PDI and prepare a report to assist the court in framing a placement order under the commitment.  
All the defendant's treatment records requested by the investigator be released to the investigator.  
Report to be furnished no later than 8/11/2015.
All other counts and files are dismissed and read-in pursuant to the plea agreement. 

Atty Drengler to prepare the further orders needed at the final hearing.
Plea hearing at 06-09-2015 10:30 am
Defendant Record Update
Pre-trial conference on March 30, 2015 at 10:00 am.
and Dr. Ralph Baker invoice. /s/TTF 02-03-15  Original filed in 13CF372
Pre-Trial Supervision Program Report
Pre-trial conference on January 26, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Jessie J Howen in court with attorney Ryan W. Drengler. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
All files heard: 13CF372, 13CF390, 14CF34, 14CF35, 14CF155, 14CF287, 14CF426, 14CM165

9:44 a.m.  Court calls the case.  
Court reviews the files.  Summarizes the discussion between the parties in chamber. 
Matter will be set for a pre-trial.  If parties are prepared to proceed on 1/26, then the Court will do or another date will be set. 
Court notes there was a report by PTSP.  Court did enter an order that he no longer have to participate that. 
Clerk notes a copy of the minutes from the 10/13 hearing were sent to PTSP. 
Atty Knaapen states he will contact day report and advise them of the change.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for January 26, 2015 at 10:00 am.
and Dr. Baker invoice /s/TTF 12-02-14. - Original filed in 13CF372
Order for Examination under 971.16-NGI - Dr Ralph Baker /a/TTF

Amended 10/13/2014:
Court will allow the defendant to move to Bailey's Harbor. 
No longer subject to the Day Report Requirements. 

Bond covers all files: 13CF372, 13CF390, 14CF34, 14CF35.
All conditions of all bonds remain the same:
13CF372:
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription  and be taken according to the prescription. Do not possess any drug paraphernalia. Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment. 
Do not have direct/indirect contact with the following persons/places:   Diana Howen-Knapp.  
01-27-14***Amended, to allow contact between himself and mother. If she files a Family Safety Plan w/the Clerk of Court and DA office*****
Participate in the Portage County Pre-Trial Supervision Program and comply with the requirements for reporting, assessment, and programming.
No dangersous weapons in possession of defendant.
***01-27-14:    CAP Services: Personalized Family Safety Plan filed by: Diana Howen-Knapp****
Status conference on December 19, 2014 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Jessie J Howen in court with attorney Ryan W. Drengler. Ryan Drengler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
All files heard: 13CF372, 13CF390, 14CF34, 14CF35, 14CF155, 14CF287, 14CM165
Motion for Bond Modification

Atty Drengler makes arguments in support of the motion to modify bond.  
Court questions parties.  NGI examiner is now deceased.  Court was not notified to appoint a new examiner. 
Atty Drengler states he has dropped off orders. 
Court has found the documents and finds they are not the proper forms.  
Court questions defendant. 
Court questions defendant's mother, Diana Howen-Knapp.

BY THE COURT:  
Court amends all the bonds: 
Court will allow the defendant to move to Bailey's Harbor. 
No longer subject to the Day Report Requirements. 
Court will find a new doctor to appoint to all cases.  Will send letters to the parties.  
Advises Atty Drengler to contact the defendant to schedule the appointments.  Status conference scheduled for December 19, 2014 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Jessie J Howen in court with attorney Ryan W Drengler. David R Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
(14CF155 preliminary hearing was held and 14CM165 status conference was held.  

The following files have been added to enter an NGI plea).
Atty Drengler indicates the defendant would like to enter a NGI plea to all his files. 

NOT GUILTY by Mental Disease or Defect Pleas entered to all files: 13CF372, 13CF390, 14CF34, 14CF35, 14CF155, 14CM165

Bond Continued.  Status conference scheduled for May 12, 2014 at 09:30 am.
Covered by 13CF372 bond.
Pre-trial conference on April 28, 2014 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Jessie J Howen appeared by video. Prosecuting Atty Cass Cousins appeared for State of Wisconsin.
All files heard: 13CF372, 13CF390, 14CF34, 14CF35

Court reviews the files. 
Court questions defendant. 
Defendant indicates he is represented by Atty Drengler. 
Court advises defendant of right to remain silent/make statement. 

Atty Cousins makes statements to the Court with re: to status of these cases.  Requests a $2,500 cash bond to cover all files with the same conditions. 
Defendant makes statements to the Court. 
Court again advises defendant of statements. 
Defendant informs the Court he understands and continues with his statements.  Requests a $5,000 signature bond.  
Court questions defendant. 
Defendant indicates he will be living with his mother who resides in Plover. 
Atty Cousins makes additional statements to the Court. 
Defendant interrupts Atty Cousins. 
Court again advises defendant re: making of statements. 
Court has read the complaints in all of the cases. 

BY THE COURT:
Court advises the defendant to contact his attorney, jail assist if they can. 
  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 28, 2014 at 10:00 am.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 28, 2014 at 10:00 am.

Arraignment on March 10, 2014 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Jessie J Howen in court with attorney Ryan Drengler. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard are 14CF-34 and 14CF-35.

3:42 PM Court calls cases.
Atty Knaapen states appearances.

Atty Knaapen states that this Defendant will be waiving preliminary hearing in both files.

Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing, written waivers have been filed.
Court questions defendant regarding waiver of preliminary hearing. 

Court finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the preliminary hearing. 
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial. 

Bond is ordered continued.

13CF-372 and 13CF-390 are to track as status conferences along with these files.
  Arraignment scheduled for March 10, 2014 at 10:00 am.
